page.title: 10A Farmer's Wife.
page.content: Mrs.C. the farmer's wife has to get up early in the morning to get all her jobs done. After breakfast she helps her children get ready for school and if it is wet, she drives them there in the car. The farm has a large flock of sheep and this year she has 21 cade lambs to rear by hand. She feeds them several times a day with warm powdered milk in a bottle. As they grow larger she weans them on to solid food and then they do not need so much of her time. When the lambs are big enough they are taken to Skegness and sold. Mrs.C. has l5 chickens which lay about 5 dozen eggs per week. These have to be fed and the eggs collected. She also has 5 pedigree Scottish Border sheep dogs from which they breed twice a year. She has spent all her life on one farm or another.
